title: So legit Question as Diamond Melee Main
body:
How do you beat a champion that is:
Ranged
Point and click snare
Higher mobility
Higher damage
Shield
Better minion clearing

This is legit question. INB4 team mate, assume my team is useless. 
Yes I understand ryze has a super low winrate, yes this question is about him.

Edit: 
No standing behind minions doesn't work, he just bounces damage through them. 
Not fighting/ staying out of range isn't counterplay. 
No you cannot just "dodge" he has a point and click snare. 
This question is also related to lane phase because in teamfight phase he is well killable because teammates.

If you are picking a juggernaut, you can't really expect to win lane phase against a ranged champion.

This is what you get for absolutely shitting on some other champions during lane phase.

Ask yourself how do you win lane phase as {{champion:78}} into {{champion:82}} and the answer is the same - you don't.

The simple answer is you don't.
Also he outscales you.
Welcome to riot balance. :)

Sorry bud, but you are playing a champion with extremely limited options in that kind of matchup. And Ryze would be by no means the roughest matchup you can have either.

Literally your best option is going second wind and dorans shield, rushing Spirit Visage and mercs and then getting a damage item. Accept that you aren't going to hyper carry unless your jungler gets a good gank or two for you. But as you know, from the mid to late you can still do Morde things, you just have limited opportunity to win the lane.

Was this top lane by any chance? IF so, you could always try to abuse the brushes which are a way around his point and click. But even then it is situational based.

Having looked around in the thread, you were playing morde?

You´ll wana start either corruption potion or dorans shield to deal with the poke, second wind from the resolve tree would also be helpful

Goal should be just surviving, because a slow melee juggernaut basically does not beat a ranged carry in lane, just survive and try to put the wave in a good spot to make ganks look good and your jungler will help get you ahead to the point where you should be able to just roll over the Ryze or a karma even.

Thats all, same idea as playing basically any marksman with a weak support or playing a mid/lategame one against Draven/Lucian.

Or playing a slowly scaling melee into Darius/renek.

Try to make him run out of mana before his first back and wait for ganks, try not to take too much poke before so even if you have to give up some CS...just stay in XP rangeww

Ryze is pretty easy to gank top lane generally. Is he running Phase Rush or Aftershock?

It obviously depends on the champion your playing, but if you're, let's say a juggernaut, I would say that a Doran's shield with Second Wind in your runes would help you out a lot. Even tought you said that not fighting isn't counterplay, it actually is in my opinion. Your job to win the lane in that case is to not fall behind and not die, because unless Ryze player fucks up, you won't be touching him at all or winning in 1vs1 scenarios. Nevertheless, like you said he tends to push the wave quite a lot, wich makes him vulnerable to ganks and also Ryze n my opniion has a huge disadvantage at lv6, because his ultimate is not a ability that does a lot while fighting.

But yeah, I think overall you have to change your definition of winning considering the matchup.  In certains matchups, not dying and just play it safe and not lose EXP and get the most CS possible is a win situation. I think people misunderstand this a lot.

"Oh, Veigar and Talon are in equals terms because none of them died and both have the same CS" - Wrong. Talon has a lot of kill pressure and falls off, while Veigar actually scales very well into the mid and late game - AKA Veigar is winning the lane. - Just using as an example.

learned this with pantheon a couple of seasons ago playing champs like fiora and yasuo. being only 10 cs down, but even in xp and not dying to the panth at 10 minutes, is you dominating the lane. Because you are going to be more useful late game and outscale him.

1) Ryze's Snare is always more effective if the target is Fluxed' so technically yes...... you can dodge part of it. 

2) You don't engage Ryze directly. You bait out the root, and then peel away. 5 Seconds later or so, you dive him. His W will be on cooldown, and all he will have is Flux + Overload, and you can dodge Overload.

3) Have enough Shield/Magic resist to mitigate a chunk of the damage. Like all strong solo mages, Resist is anathema to executions. 

You basically have to disrupt his combo by taking part of it.

{{item:3156}} {{item:3139}} {{item:3065}} {{item:3512}} {{item:3091}} all help this fight.

The good thing about Ryze's Root: It's short. .75 -1.5 seconds. Most Roots are much longer.
You realize that he has two point and clicks and his non-snare point and click fluxes you (if he needs) right?

I do. Which is why I ultimately concluded you need to unfortunately take some of the hits. Running away from Ryze long enough to put his root on cooldown is a viable strategy. You just need to go back in before it's up. You might be 60% HP from the first encounter, but that's enough if his Root is on cooldown and the rest does half its potential damage, especially if you have shield items like a Maw/Steraks.

nvm.

You all in him, that's all. He can't brawl at all, especially early on where he doesn't have ANYTHING. Abuse his early, abuse that his Snare is super short in duration. Get Merc Treads and just faceroll him.

It's kinda like playing vs jayce or pantheon early on. You play the sustain game. He has limited mana if he's going to spam a full combo on you... you have limited hp. Try to out-sustain him and stay decent in cs. If you're playing a tank with no sustain then I'm sorry, but rush catalyst (for the sustain it gives) and/or mr is the best advice. If you're playing a damage dealer like darius, renekton, fiora, etc. I'd actually recommend grasp... but that's just my playstyle. It gives you better ability to outlast him in lane while giving you some nice scaling and durability too. Another thing you can do is focus on just shoving the wave as quickly as possible and then bouncing back to base so that any damage ryze does to you while you shove lane doesn't matter because you'll heal it in base and return top when he's just pushed wave to your tower.

Panthion does't go back and purchase a tear and or lost chapter and never run out of mana. 

How do you suggest clearing the wave when him being able to kill you at level 3 with his point and click snare is part of the issue. He snares you outside of caster range drops a shitload of damage on you which also clears your melee minions.

If you snag a sustain champ top pantheon cannot harass you more than you can sustain so long as you don't take bad trades. You don't necessarily win the trades or win in farm, but you don't get low and die either. And then when he's low, you can build up a wave, shove it in, base and return to catch wave at your tower with reasonably close item power to what panth has. If he's not going oom, then he's not harassing you enough to give a crap about his damage and he might as well have picked a scaling champ like gp or jax or fiora.

Ryze? Ryze doesn't kill anyone in a single spell rotation. He can't use 2 rotations immediately in a row. So if he holds onto spells hoping to catch you with the spread effect of using one on minions already hit by it, you can give up a whole one cs, force him to waste it on the wave w/o hitting you, and then do a trade after because he can't combo you then w/o hitting you directly with first spell and even then you are trading combos. If he does use it on wave... great, his combo is down for a few sec, shove away and force him under tower. It's not rocket science or particle physics. Just like with any other champ, the best way to trade is when they can't properly do full combo on you... the second best is when they can either combo you OR farm minions and you force them to CHOOSE one or other and then abuse them for whichever choice they make.

Gangplank seems pretty good against him. I figure Nasus and Cho'gath might be, too. 

Vi? Zed? Cassiopeia? Diana? Gnar? Jayce? Garen? All these should do just fine against him.

Basically, play Irelia.
W during the root duration and then use your 3 dashes (given that you hit your skills) to fuck him up.
Maybe Kled can work too because he got 2 dashes and his ult, but I feel like Ryze outscales him super hard so you'd have to get a decisive advantage early on.

As Morde? Whip out Ol' Reliable: the banhammer.

Didn't ban him? Console yourself with the thought that 18 LP doesn't take long to recover.
